introduce.description: Scenarios help you orchestrate more complex requirements or user stories. Compared to single-step test cases, scenarios can contain more steps and processes.
introduce.capabilities: Here you and your team can complete the following work:
introduce.capability3: Quickly generate scenario test scripts and tasks.

edit.monitorNamePlaceholder: Enter monitor name, up to 100 characters
edit.descriptionPlaceholder: Enter monitor description, up to 200 characters
edit.notificationHint: After enabling notifications, messages will be automatically sent to recipients when monitoring runs fail.

detail.executionRecordsHint: Note: Only shows the last 100 monitoring records.

list.noMonitors: You haven't added any monitors yet,
list.deleteConfirm: Are you sure you want to delete monitor 【{name}】?

introduce.description: Scenario monitoring helps us understand system or business status from an interface perspective, identify and resolve potential issues in a timely manner, thereby improving system reliability and user satisfaction, and providing strong support for stable business operations. Main application scenarios are as follows:

apiDelay.title: API Delay Monitoring
apiDelay.description: Track API response times to ensure access experience. For example: Monitor the average response time of payment APIs to ensure it doesn't exceed 500ms.

healthCheck.title: Check System Health Status
healthCheck.description: Determine if the system is running normally in a quick and simple way. For example: Verify the running status of components in system or service health check endpoints (/health).

apiFunctionality.title: API Functionality Correctness Check
apiFunctionality.description: Regularly test the functional correctness of APIs to ensure expected behavior. For example: Automatically test user registration APIs to verify account creation processes.

businessProcess.title: Critical Business Process Monitoring
businessProcess.description: Monitor the integrity and correctness of core business processes. For example: Whether payment orders and payment amounts are consistent in business up to the current time.

scenarioTrash.title: Trash
scenarioTrash.description: Only administrators and deleters can restore or permanently delete data from the trash.

messages.deleteConfirm: Deleting the scenario will synchronously delete associated follows, favourites, metrics, variables and other information. Please confirm whether to delete 【{name}】?
messages.deleteSuccess: Delete successfully, you can view the deleted scenario in the trash.
messages.reopenConfirm: Update all completed task statuses under the scenario to "Pending Test", without clearing statistical counts and status. Do you confirm to reopen the test task 【{name}】?
messages.restartConfirm: Update all completed task statuses under the scenario to "Pending Test", related statistical counts and status will be cleared. Do you confirm to restart the test 【{name}】?

tips.authOn: After enabling "Permission Control", you need to manually authorize service permissions to have corresponding operation permissions for scenarios. "Permission Control" is enabled by default. Note: If the authorized object does not have parent directory permissions, view permissions will be automatically authorized.
tips.authOff: After enabling "No Permission Control", all users will be allowed to publicly view and operate the current scenario. Users viewing need to have current scenario parent directory permissions.
tips.testTaskInfo: Generate corresponding tasks when scenario test tasks do not exist. If tasks already exist, current test information will be overwritten.

radioOptions.useDefault: Use Default (Default server configuration in scenario)
radioOptions.modifyConfig: Modify Variable Configuration (Will update to interface and variable server after modification)
